meanings.definition: Existing or occurring in the same period of time.
meanings.sent1: The two paintings were contemporaneous, both created during the Renaissance era.
meanings.sent2: The historian studied the contemporaneous documents to understand the events of the past.
meanings.sent3: It was a funny coincidence that their birthdays were contemporaneous, falling on the same day.
meanings.sent4: The music from the two bands was contemporaneous, blending seamlessly into a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a contemporaneous example to explain how history repeats itself.

meanings.definition: Of the same age or date.
meanings.sent1: The twins were contemporaneous, celebrating their birthdays together every year.
meanings.sent2: The artifacts found in the tomb were contemporaneous, dating back to the same era.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to discover that the two ancient scrolls were contemporaneous, written by the same scribe.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like a pair of contemporaneous books, sharing the same chapters of life.
meanings.sent5: The siblings shared a contemporaneous bond, always understanding each other without words.
